Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one land and one water, showing a variety of living things in each.
The student can illustrate specific examples of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or bushes in land habitats and aquatic plants in water habitats.
The student can depict specific examples of animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, or ants in land habitats and fish or clams in water habitats.
The student can demonstrate an understanding of diversity by including different types of living things within each habitat.
The student can show patterns of plant and animal diversity by comparing the different living things found in the two habitats.
